comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "Knud Knudsen (1832-1915) was one of Norway's first professional photographers. His work includes images from most of Norway in his time and documents much of Norwegian history and ethnology in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. ... He traveled extensively throughout Norway and left a collection of at least 16,000 images." – Wikipedia

comment.author: 37381115@N04
comment._content: @Pixel Wrangler - thanks, The University of Bergen has made a great job of hosting the complete collection left after Knud: www.ub.uib.no/knudsenbilder/
